revised_title: Navigational Observations and Meteorological Data from a Voyage to Hudson's Bay
tldr: This article documents the observations made by Captain Christopher Middleton during his voyage from London to Hudson's Bay in 1735. The observations include latitude, magnetic needle variation, and weather data. The author also discusses the use of various nautical instruments, such as Mr. Smith's Prismatic Quadrant and Mr. Hadley's instrument, in navigating and measuring the ship's position.
